text: Well, I was at work one day I was doing my usual job working on the warehouse floor stocking boxes organizing merchandise I had been working for a few hours it was getting late
keypoint: Working late, I felt strange and lightheaded

text: I had been feeling a bit strange a bit lightheaded but chalked it up to hunger not having eaten yet that day But then, as I was walking around the warehouse returning items to their proper places I started to feel a strange tightness
keypoint: Blaming hunger, I continued working despite chest pressure

text: and pressure in my chest I stopped what I was doing leaned against a nearby wall for a bit the pressure only got stronger I could feel my heart pounding in my chest Next thing I know, I started seeing spots I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead
keypoint: Chest pressure worsened, leading to fear and physical symptoms

text: my arms I tried to take some deep breaths I just couldn't catch my breath I was really scared didn't know what to do. Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse. It was the manager
keypoint: Unable to breathe, I was scared and unresponsive

text: who had seen me called out to me it seems someone had noticed me was checking to see if I was alright I tried to yell back that something was wrong I couldn't find my voice. The manager started walking towards me
keypoint: The manager noticed my distress and approached to help

text: I could feel my world going dark I started to drop to the ground luckily the manager got to me in time caught me just before my legs gave out He took me to the staff room sat me down in a chair He asked me questions about what was wrong
keypoint: Manager caught me as I collapsed, took me to rest

text: what happened He got me a glass of cold water told me to rest for a bit After a few minutes the pressure in my chest slowly eased up I started to feel better It turned out I had been having a panic attack
keypoint: After resting, I realized it was a panic attack

text: I escaped from the situation the help of the quick action of the manager It was never a fun experience it really could have been much worse it taught me to check in with myself make sure to properly rest eat to avoid further episodes
keypoint: The experience taught me to prioritize self-care
